metadata.name: Potential SPN Enumeration Via Setspn.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects service principal name (SPN) enumeration used for Kerberoasting

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\setspn.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('setspn.exe') AND contains(lower(device.desc), lower('query or reset the computer')) AND contains(lower(device.desc), lower('spn attribute')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -q ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' /q '))))

output.summary: Detects service principal name (SPN) enumeration used for Kerberoasting
